frame.name: Partiality
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame has to do with the bias or lack of bias of a <fen>Judge</fen> making an assessment concerning two or more <fen>Sides</fen>. The <fen>Sides</fen> may stand opposed to each other in a dispute or be alternatives in a situation of choice. The <fen>Domain</fen> in which the <fen>Judge</fen> is partial or impartial may be expressed as well as the <fen>Degree</fen> of bias or lack thereof. In sentences in this frame one may also find expressions of <fen>Manifestation_of_bias</fen>, i.e. expressions that tell us how the <fen>Judge</fen>'s bias is realized.
<ex><fex name="Decision_maker">The judge</fex> made a <t>biased</t> <fex name="Manifestation_of_bias">decision</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Decision_maker
FE.definition:
<def-root>This Frame Element marks the person whose objectivity in making assesment is being evaluated.
<ex><fex name="Decision_maker">The referee</fex> was totally <t>biased</t> against our team. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Side_1
FE.definition: <def-root>This Frame Element marks one of the <fen>Sides</fen> in a dispute or one of the alternatives in a situation of choice.<ex>The umpire was <t>partial</t> <fex name="Side_1">to the home team</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Sides
FE.definition: <def-root>This Frame Element marks phrases jointly expressing both <fen>Sides</fen> in a dispute or all of the alternatives in a situation of choice.<ex>The judge was <t>neutral</t> <fex name="Sides">between the parties</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Side_2
FE.definition: <def-root>The second-mentioned of the <fen>Sides</fen> to a dispute or alternatives in a situation of choice.<ex>The judge <t>favored</t> the defendant <fex name="Side_2">over the plaintiff</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition: <def-root>This Frame Element marks expressions of a <fen>Domain</fen> or parameter with respect to which the <fen>Judge</fen> exhibits bias or lack thereof.<ex>The judge was <fex name="Domain">politically</fex> <t>biased</t> against the defendant.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This Frame Element marks expressions that tell to what extent the <fen>Judge</fen> exhibited or lacked bias.<ex>The referee was <fex name="Degree">totally</fex> <t>biased</t> against the Giants.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manifestation_of_bias
FE.definition: <def-root>This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate how the bias of the <fen>Judge</fen> expresses itself in their behavior or actions.<ex>The judge made a <t>biased</t> <fex name="Manifestation_of_bias">decision</fex>.</ex><ex>The referee was <t>partial</t> <fex name="Manifestation_of_bias">when he called all those fouls</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Dispute
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Dispute</fen> is the situation in which there is some conflict between two sides. <ex> <fex name="Judge">My sister</fex> remained <t>neutral</t> <fex name="Dispute">in our disputes</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Judge
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual whose point of view is taken in assigning the judgment denoted by the target.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes the time when the partiality occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Expressor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which indicates the character of the <fen>Decision_maker</fen>.
<ex>He had a <t>neutral</t> <fex name="exp">smile</fex> on his face.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> is the way in which the <fen>Decision_maker</fen> embodies the bias associated with him or her.
<ex>He was <fex name="man">cooly</fex> <t>impartial</t> towards the matter.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: bias.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: inclination or prejudice for or against one thing or person

lexUnit.name: partial.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: favouring one side in a dispute above the other;

lexUnit.name: impartial.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: treating all rivals or disputants equally.

lexUnit.name: partiality.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the quality or state of being partial to one side in a dispute

lexUnit.name: impartiality.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state or quality of being impartial to both sides in a dispute

lexUnit.name: neutrality.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: impartiality between two sides in a dispute

lexUnit.name: prefer.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: like (someone or something) better than another or otherts; tend to choose

lexUnit.name: biased.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: inclined for or against one side

lexUnit.name: prejudiced.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: Having a pre-formed bias about something.

lexUnit.name: prejudice.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: preconceived opinion that is not based on reason or actual experience.

lexUnit.name: prejudge.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: form a judgement on (an issue or person) prematurely and without having adequate information.
